subject: Travel
subcategory: The Story of Maps and Navigation
title: OpenStreetMap: The People's Map
description: Learn OpenStreetMap: The People's Map in one minute.

hook.text: OpenStreetMap is the Wikipedia of maps. Anyone can edit it, and millions of volunteers do.

buildup.text: Steve Coast started it in 2004 because British government maps were expensive and copyrighted.

discovery.text: Volunteers trace satellite images, walk streets with GPS, and add businesses, trails, and buildings.

twist.text: During disasters, volunteers map affected areas in hours. After the Haiti earthquake, OSM was the best map available.

climax.text: Facebook, Apple, and Amazon all use OpenStreetMap data. A free map powers billion-dollar companies.

punchline.text: Volunteers built a map that tech giants depend on.

quiz.question: What is OpenStreetMap?
options: A volunteer-edited free map like Wikipedia
